result.execSummary:
The defendant Enrique J Pena Soto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Case 22CM789 is dismissed and read in

Costs to be paid $25.00 a month commencing 12/01/2022 and the 1st of each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Restitution was paid in full to DA's office prior to sentencing.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Enrique J Pena Soto

4:04 PM Defendant Enrique J Pena Soto appeared by video.  Attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski in court for Enrique J Pena Soto.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of  no contest to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1
Court dismisses and reads in Counts 2 and 3. 
Court dismisses and reads in Case 22CM789. 

Court orders the following:
2 Days Waukesha County Jail
2 DAYS CREDIT
TIME SERVED 
	
Costs:  $243.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month, starting 12/1/22 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  entry of civil judgment

Restitution is paid in full.

Defendants class went long and was unable to get a ride to court on time.
